Description: In this session, we will cover: Trials that test multi-drug combinations; Trials with dual endpoints (toxicity and efficacy); Novel statistical methodology to handle patient heterogeneity; the TARGET-CRM Bayesian adaptive design for dose-finding whereby patients with the targeted mutation are permitted to enroll even when a dose-level cohort is full; the Sub-TITE-CRM design using DLT-free time as the primary endpoint, and which borrows/clusters information across patient strata; Standard operating procedures for real-time data and communication in adaptive trials; and, the DEDUCE (DEsign & conDUCt of dose Escalation trials) app to compare operating characteristics across designs.  The session will also cover phase 2 randomized trials, and single arm phase 3 which resemble phase 2 designs.  In a series of case studies, we will tell the story of the evolution of novel phase 2 trial designs in pediatric oncology and rare tumors, including the use of historical control data.
